<p style="color: green; font-size: 1.6em; font-weight: bold;">
Workshop 4: Geospatial Mapping with R for Health Data R</p>

<p style="color: red; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
One- Day Training Course Outline </p>

<p style="color: black; font-size: 1.3em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Description
</p>

This course introduces geospatial data analysis and mapping using R, a powerful programming language for statistical computing and data visualization. Participants will learn to work with geospatial data, analyze spatial relationships, and create informative maps for visualizing geographic information in public health contexts. Through hands-on exercises, attendees will explore techniques for identifying spatial patterns, overlaying datasets, and communicating insights effectively.

<p style="color: red; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Prerequisites
</p>

-   Basic familiarity with R and RStudio (e.g., data structures, scripts).
-   Experience importing data (CSV, Excel, databases) into R.

<p style="color: green; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Outcomes
</p>

-   Load, manipulate, and visualize spatial data in R.
-   Apply common geospatial analysis techniques.
-   Create visually compelling maps to communicate health insights.

<p style="color: blue; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Objectives
</p>

-   Understand geospatial data types: vector (points, lines, polygons) and raster data.
-   Work with formats like Shapefiles, GeoJSON, and raster datasets.
-   Use R packages (`sf`, `sp`, `raster`, `ggmap`) for geospatial workflows.
-   Clean, transform, and reproject spatial data (including handling missing values).
-   Perform spatial joins, buffer analysis, and nearest neighbor calculations.
-   Create choropleth maps, point maps, and interactive visualizations.
-   Overlay demographic/environmental data to enrich health analyses.

<p style="color: blue; font-size: 1.2em; font-weight: bold;">
Course Outline
</p>

## Course Outline

+-----+-------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| No. | Topic                               | Sub-topic                                                                                                                                 |
+=====+=====================================+===========================================================================================================================================+
| 1   | Introduction to Geospatial Data     | -   Geospatial data types: vector (points, lines, polygons) and raster data                                                               |

|     |                                     | -   Reprojecting spatial data into different coordinate systems for consistent analysis                                                   |

| 4   | Geospatial Analysis Techniques      | -   Spatial joins and overlays                                                                                                            |
|     |                                     | -   Buffer analysis                                                                                                                       |
|     |                                     | -   Nearest neighbour analysis                                                                                                            |
|     |                                     | -   Spatial interpolation                                                                                                                 |
|     |                                     | -   Geospatial statistics and spatial econometrics                                                                                        |
+-----+-------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 5   | Visualization of Geospatial Data    | -   Creating maps with `ggplot2` and `tmap`                                                                                               |
|     |                                     | -   Adding map layers, styling, and customizing map elements (labels, legends, and scales)                                                |
+-----+-------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
